intro: Gorteria arachnoidea, commonly known as the spider orchid, is a South African plant belonging to the Iridaceae family. It is characterized by its unique, intricate inflorescence that resembles a spider's web, giving it its common name. The plant produces striking, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and mountainous regions. Gorteria arachnoidea is a perennial herb that blooms during the summer months.
